lessons.title: Easier to understand
lessons.interactiveContent:
Understanding data is easier when the items are ordered, like patients ordered by their name.

Make sure to pick ORDER BY name, followed by ;.

lessons.title: Select all
lessons.interactiveContent:
To order items in a table, we first need to select them. Start by coding SELECT *.

Make sure to type SELECT *.

lessons.title: Specify table
lessons.interactiveContent:
We then specify the table that we're selecting from, in this case, patients.

Make sure to pick FROM, followed by patients, and finally ;.

lessons.title: Order by
lessons.interactiveContent:
We use the ORDER BY keywords to order the patients entries according to a property.

Make sure to type ORDER BY.

lessons.title: Column name
lessons.interactiveContent:
After ORDER BY, we code the column by which we want to order the entries, like name.

Make sure to type name.

lessons.title: Question: Easier to understand
lessons.interactiveContent:
Why would we want to order items in a table?

To easier understand and manage the stored dataBecause we can only query tables with ordered items

To easier understand and manage the stored data.

lessons.title: Question: Select all
lessons.interactiveContent:
What's the first step when ordering table items?

Selecting the items with SELECTThere is no first step, we start the query with ORDER BY

Selecting the items with SELECT.

lessons.title: Question: Specify table
lessons.interactiveContent:
What does the FROM keyword do in this query?

It specifies the table we're selecting from, countriesIt specifies the column we want to order by

It specifies the table we're selecting from, countries.

lessons.title: Question: Order by
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which keywords allow us to order selected items?

ORDER BYFROM

ORDER BY.

lessons.title: Question: Column name
lessons.interactiveContent:
By which column is this query ordering the countries items?

By the column nameBy all columns because of *

By the column name.

lessons.title: Example: Select all
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code SELECT followed by * to select all items in the countries table.

Make sure to type SELECT *.

lessons.title: Example: Specify table
lessons.interactiveContent:
Select all columns from the countries table with the FROM keyword.

Make sure to type FROM.

lessons.title: Example: Order by
lessons.interactiveContent:
Rearrange the items in the countries table with ORDER BY.

Make sure to type ORDER BY.

lessons.title: Example: Column name
lessons.interactiveContent:
Make sure that the items are ordered by their values in the name column.

Make sure to pick ORDER BY, followed by name.

lessons.title: Text vs. Numbers
lessons.interactiveContent:
Ordering by text properties like name is different than ordering by numeric properties like age.

Click the buttons to check it out.

lessons.title: Alphabetical order
lessons.interactiveContent:
Ordering by a column with text values like name arranges the items in alphabetical order, based on the first letter of their name.

Make sure to pick ORDER BY, followed by name.

lessons.title: Numerical order
lessons.interactiveContent:
When ordering by numerical values, like age, items are arranged in numerical order, based on their age values.

Make sure to type age.

lessons.title: Ascending vs. Descending
lessons.interactiveContent:
We can order items ascending starting with the smallest value, or descending.

Click the buttons to order ascending or descending by age.

lessons.title: Ascending by default
lessons.interactiveContent:
ORDER BY orders items ascending by default, which is the same as adding the ASC keyword at the end.

Make sure to pick ORDER BY, followed by age, and finally ASC.

lessons.title: Descending order
lessons.interactiveContent:
To order items in descending order, we code the DESC keyword after the column name.

Make sure to type DESC.

lessons.title: Question: Alphabetical order
lessons.interactiveContent:
How are the items arranged when we order by a column with text values?

Alphabetically, according to their values in that columnWe can't order by text values

Alphabetically, according to their values in that column.

lessons.title: Question: Numerical order
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which item comes first when ordering by a column with numerical values?

The item with the smallest value in that columnWe can't know which item comes first

The item with the smallest value in that column.

lessons.title: Question: Ascending by defaullt
lessons.interactiveContent:
What's the difference between these two queries?

There is no difference, ORDER BY orders ascending by defaultThe first one uses ASC to order ascending, while the second orders descending

There is no difference, ORDER BY orders ascending by default.

lessons.title: Question: Descending order
lessons.interactiveContent:
How do we order items in descending order?

By coding the DESC keyword after the column nameBy coding the ASC keyword after the column name

By coding the DESC keyword after the column name.

lessons.title: Example: Alphabetical order
lessons.interactiveContent:
Choose a column so that the table is ordered alphabetically.

Make sure to pick name.

lessons.title: Example: Numerical order
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code a column name, so that the table is ordered by a numerical property.

Make sure to type gdp.

lessons.title: Example: Ascending by default
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code a keyword so that this query continues to arrange items in ascending order.

Make sure to pick ASC.

lessons.title: Example: Descending order
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code a keyword so that the item with the name value Sweden comes first.

Make sure to pick DESC.
